templo-expiatorio-de-la-sagrada-familia-.title: Templo Expiatorio de la Sagrada Familia
templo-expiatorio-de-la-sagrada-familia-.description: "The Basílica i Temple Expiatori de la Sagrada Família is a large Roman Catholic church in Barcelona, Spain, designed by Catalan architect Antoni Gaudí. Although incomplete, the church is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and in November 2010 Pope Benedict XVI consecrated and proclaimed it a minor basilica.Construction of Sagrada Família had commenced in 1882 and Gaudí became involved in 1883, taking over the project and transforming it with his architectural and engineering style, combining Gothic and curvilinear Art Nouveau forms. Gaudí devoted his last years to the project."

la-sagrada-familia.title: La Sagrada Familia
la-sagrada-familia.description: The Basílica i Temple Expiatori de la Sagrada Família is a large Roman Catholic church in Barcelona, Spain, designed by Catalan architect Antoni Gaudí. Although incomplete, the church is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and in November 2010 Pope Benedict XVI consecrated and proclaimed it a minor basilica.Construction of Sagrada Família had commenced in 1882 and Gaudí became involved in 1883, taking over the project and transforming it with his architectural and engineering style, combining Gothic and curvilinear Art Nouveau forms. Gaudí devoted his last years to the project.

raco-den-marc-els-ports-natural-park.title: Racó d'en Marc - Els Ports Natural Park
raco-den-marc-els-ports-natural-park.description: Els Ports is a limestone mountain massif located at the north-eastern end of the Sistema Ibérico, a complex system of mountain ranges and massifs in the centre of the Iberian Peninsula.

estartit-cala-montgo-montgri-medes-islan.title: Estartit - Cala Montgó, Montgrí, Medes Islands and Baix Ter Natural Park
estartit-cala-montgo-montgri-medes-islan.description: Montgrí, Medes Islands and Baix Ter Natural Park is a natural park located in the province of Girona, Catalonia, Spain. The park was established in 2010 and encompasses the Medes Islands, the Montgrí Massif and the mouth of the Ter river, covering a land area and a marine protected.

montgri-castle.title: Montgrí Castle
montgri-castle.description: The Montgrí Castle is a historical edifice in Torroella de Montgrí, Catalonia, Spain, built between 1294 and 1301.

requesens-castle.title: Requesens Castle
requesens-castle.description: Requesens Castle is a historical building in the municipality of la Jonquera, Catalonia, Spain. The edifice is characterized by a triple line of walls, with square and rounded towers, portals and merlons. In the lower court is the chapel, including Romanesque elements from original structures of the area, or of French inspiration.

estana-prat-de-cadi-cadi-moixero-natural.title: Estana - Prat de Cadí, Cadí-Moixeró Natural Park
estana-prat-de-cadi-cadi-moixero-natural.description: The Cadí-Moixeró Natural Park is a natural park to the north of Catalonia, Spain

san-mauricio-lake-aiguestortes-i-estany-.title: San Mauricio Lake, Aigüestortes i Estany de Sant Maurici National Park
san-mauricio-lake-aiguestortes-i-estany-.description: Aigüestortes i Estany de Sant Maurici National Park is one of the fourteen Spanish National Parks, and the only one located in Catalonia with a very different ecosystems.

camino-del-estany-llong-i-el-portarro-de.title: Camino del Estany Llong i el Portarró D'Espot, Alt Pirineu Natural Park
camino-del-estany-llong-i-el-portarro-de.description: Alt Pirineu Natural Park is the largest natural park in Catalonia, including the highest peaks of the Pyrenees in Catalonia.

royal-monastery-of-santes-creus.title: Royal monastery of Santes Creus
royal-monastery-of-santes-creus.description: The monastery's origins date to 1158, when the Lords of Montagut y de Albá donated the village of Santes Creus to the monks of Valdaura. The papal decree that was required to establish a monastery was made by Pope Alexander II, and construction of the monastery began in 1174. The complex was completed in 1225.

monastery-of-sant-pere-de-rodes.title: Monastery of Sant Pere de Rodes
monastery-of-sant-pere-de-rodes.description: Sant Pere de Rodes (Catalan pronunciation: [ˈsam ˈpeɾə ðə ˈrɔðəs]) is a former Benedictine monastery in the comarca of Alt Empordà, in the North East of Catalonia, Spain. The true origin of the monastery is not known, which has given rise to speculation and legend; such as its foundation by monks who disembarked in the area with the remains of Saint Peter and other saints, to save them from the Barbarian hordes that invaded the Western Roman Empire. Once the danger had passed the Pope Boniface IV commanded them to construct a monastery.

castle-of-montsoriu.title: Castle of Montsoriu
castle-of-montsoriu.description: Montsoriu Castle is located between the towns of Arbucias, Breda and Sant Feliu de Buixalleu in the Catalan region of the Forest, is located on a hill 650 meters within Montseny Natural Park. Residence of the Viscounts of Cabrera, living times of great splendor when these gentlemen owned large tracts of land and castles, which were increasing their loyalty to the king, Pedro IV of Aragon of Aragon, in 1356, created for them the new county Osona. Accused by Queen Eleanor of Sicily, Bernat II, was beheaded in Zaragoza in 1364, his son Bernat III took up arms against Pedro IV, the fight lasted until the death of Viscount and was his son Bernat IV de Cabrera, who signed a according to Pedro IV in 1372 and later in 1381 another second, getting recover the possessions of the family.

royal-monastery-of-santes-creus-2.title: Royal monastery of Santes Creus
royal-monastery-of-santes-creus-2.description: The monastery's origins date to 1158, when the Lords of Montagut y de Albá donated the village of Santes Creus to the monks of Valdaura. The papal decree that was required to establish a monastery was made by Pope Alexander II, and construction of the monastery began in 1174. The complex was completed in 1225.

empuries-archaeological-site.title: Empuries archaeological site
empuries-archaeological-site.description: Empúries (Catalan pronunciation: [əmˈpuɾiəs]), formerly known by its Spanish name Ampurias (Spanish pronunciation: [amˈpuɾjas]), was a town on the Mediterranean coast of the Catalan comarca of Alt Empordà in Catalonia, Spain. It was founded in 575 BC by Greek colonists from Phocaea with the name of Ἐμπόριον (Emporion, meaning "trading place", cf. emporion). It was later occupied by the Romans (Latin: Emporiæ), but in the Early Middle Ages, when its exposed coastal position left it open to marauders, the town was abandoned.

carthusian-monastery-of-escaladei-1.title: Carthusian Monastery of Escaladei
carthusian-monastery-of-escaladei-1.description: Scala Dei was a fully working monastery until 1835, experiencing moments of great riches and splendour. During the seven centuries the monks lived here, they built mills and taught different farming techniques which included planting vineyards on the steep slate-based slopes of the region. Thanks to these monks, the Priorat is now famous for its wines.

empuries-archaeological-site-1.title: Empuries archaeological site
empuries-archaeological-site-1.description: Empúries (Catalan pronunciation: [əmˈpuɾiəs]), formerly known by its Spanish name Ampurias (Spanish pronunciation: [amˈpuɾjas]), was a town on the Mediterranean coast of the Catalan comarca of Alt Empordà in Catalonia, Spain. It was founded in 575 BC by Greek colonists from Phocaea with the name of Ἐμπόριον (Emporion, meaning "trading place", cf. emporion). It was later occupied by the Romans (Latin: Emporiæ), but in the Early Middle Ages, when its exposed coastal position left it open to marauders, the town was abandoned.

monastery-of-sant-pere-de-galligants.title: Monastery of Sant Pere de Galligants
monastery-of-sant-pere-de-galligants.description: Sant Pere de Galligants is Benedictine abbey in Girona, Catalonia. Since 1857, it is home to the Archaeological Museum of Catalonia in the city. he monastery was built from 992, outside the walls of Girona, when Ramon Borrell, count of Barcelona gave to the monks rights over the quarter of Sant Pere. The monks held the ruler of the quarter until 1339, when King Peter IV of Aragon restored it to Aragon.

moja-palace.title: Moja Palace
moja-palace.description: This palatial residence, built by the Marquises of Moja, was designed by the architect Josep Mas in a late Baroque style in which the influence of French Neo-Classicism can be seen. It was completed in 1784.

palau-de-la-generalitat-de-catalunya.title: Palau de la Generalitat de Catalunya
palau-de-la-generalitat-de-catalunya.description: The Palau de la Generalitat is a historic palace in Barcelona, Catalonia, northern Spain. It houses the offices of the Presidency of the Generalitat de Catalunya. It is one of the few buildings of medieval origin in Europe that still functions as a seat of government and houses the institution that originally built it.

carthusian-monastery-of-escaladei.title: Carthusian Monastery of Escaladei
carthusian-monastery-of-escaladei.description: Scala Dei was a fully working monastery until 1835, experiencing moments of great riches and splendour. During the seven centuries the monks lived here, they built mills and taught different farming techniques which included planting vineyards on the steep slate-based slopes of the region. Thanks to these monks, the Priorat is now famous for its wines.

castle-monastery-of-escornalbou.title: Castle Monastery of Escornalbou
castle-monastery-of-escornalbou.description: Escornalbou takes us into a time when the well-to-do bourgeoisie restored ancient buildings to turn them into residences. And so, in 1911 Eduard Toda bought the ancient monastery of Sant Miquel d'Escornalbou and restored it with total freedom.

castle-of-cardona.title: Castle of Cardona
castle-of-cardona.description: The Castle of Cardona (Catalan: Castell de Cardona, IPA: [kəsˈteʎ də kərˈðonə]) is arguably the most important medieval fortress in the Principality of Catalonia. It is situated on a hill overlooking the river valley of the Cardener and the town of Cardona.

museum-and-archaeological-site-of-ullast.title: Museum and archaeological site of Ullastret
museum-and-archaeological-site-of-ullast.description: The Ullastret Museum details the Iberian culture from the northeast region of Catalonia, through excavations conducted on sites within the Ullastret archaeological compound.

cathedral-of-st-mary-of-la-seu-vella.title: Cathedral of St. Mary of La Seu Vella
cathedral-of-st-mary-of-la-seu-vella.description: "The Cathedral of St. Mary of La Seu Vella (Catalan and Spanish: Catedral de Santa Maria de la Seu Vella, English: St. Mary of the Old See) is the former cathedral church of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Lleida, in Lleida, Catalonia, Spain, located on top of Lleida hill.In 1707, the Gothic cathedral was turned into a military citadel by decision of King Philip V of Spain. The new cathedral, known as the Seu Nova (English: New See) and located downhill at Carrer Major, was consecrated in 1781.[1]Nevertheless, the Seu Vella is the defining monument of Lleida, the symbol of the city, being visible from its hilltop site anywhere in the city."

royal-monastery-of-santes-creus-1.title: Royal monastery of Santes Creus
royal-monastery-of-santes-creus-1.description: The monastery's origins date to 1158, when the Lords of Montagut y de Albá donated the village of Santes Creus to the monks of Valdaura. The papal decree that was required to establish a monastery was made by Pope Alexander II, and construction of the monastery began in 1174. The complex was completed in 1225.

castle-of-miravet.title: Castle of Miravet
castle-of-miravet.description: This well-conserved medieval castle is Arab in origin and later belonged to the Order of the Knights Templar. It stands like a colossal sentinel beside the Ebro river.

moja-palace-1.title: Moja Palace
moja-palace-1.description: This palatial residence, built by the Marquises of Moja, was designed by the architect Josep Mas in a late Baroque style in which the influence of French Neo-Classicism can be seen. It was completed in 1784.

parent.title: Catalonia Highlights
parent.description: Imagery of some of the most important landmarks and heritage monuments of Catalonia, Spain.
